name: The SoU Combat Cleric (18 Cleric/2 Fighter)
author: yamuchaop

posts.author: yamuchaop
posts.content:
This build was all over the place on the server i used to play on back in the day, i remember it quite fondly. The server was Realm of Krynn, a dragonlance server where i played my dwarf fighter/rogue, human barbarian/fighter, human cleric/fighter and human Illusionist. I spent a lot of time hacking away at monsters, chatting, dueling etc. Good memories :)

Human

Attributes, I do not recall them exactly, but it was something like this:
Strength - 15(18)
Dexterity - 8
Constitution - 12, i do seem to recall having a higher constitution.
Wisdom - 17(19)
Intelligence - 13
Charisma - 8

Fighter 1
Cleric 1-18
Fighter 2 - Get that discipline maxed! :)

Domains: Underscored my preference, but there where many variations.
Trickery
Strength
War
Travel - This was specifically for another server that had no haste granting items.

Skills:
Concentration: Max
Discipline: Max - Could be skipped if you where rich enough to have both a Ring of quickness (Haste) and Dragon slippers (Immune KD and fear), which i eventually was.
Spellcraft: Max
Tumble: 10

Feats - 10 picks!
Core: (7)
Weapon focus: Rapier (The best weapon on the server was a +5, keen, 1d6 acid damage, 2d8 massive critical rapier)
Improved critical: Rapier
Spell penetration
Greater spell penetration
Knockdown
Improved knockdown
Toughness
Optional: I had many variants of this character, but i have underscored my favored picks.
Extend spell
Combat casting
Blind fight (Darkness and invisibility was very common)
Luck of heroes
Empower spell
Spell focus: Conjuration (Storm of vengeance) or Evocation (Implosion, Firestorm)
Greater spell focus: Conjuration or Evocation

So how did it play? Well each player sort-of adopted their own strategies but the most common was just buffing with favour and power. I used quite a variety of tactics: harm, storm of vengeance in duels to stun-lock opponents, hammer of the gods, blade barrier, fire storm the invisible people, knockdown and of course stick 'em with the pointy end. Some players went a step further and took 16 cleric/4 fighter for weapon specialization, but i preferred the versatility of having 9th level spells. In hindsight it could probably be improved upon, but leave me my memories ;)

The most fun memory i have of this character was dueling a new comer to the server. He would show up once a day with some fancy new gear that countered my previous strategy, and i'd beat him in a new way. This continued for a month or so, until he eventually declined duels with me :)

HoU completely killed this build, i tried updating it but it was never the same again. The updated version was a cleric/fighter/rogue which was alright and also fun to play.
